å”¯å®°å‹²èˆŸä¸¹æ ½æ¯€è£‚å¥‡é‹è³Šéç•æ–¥æ¢æ‡¸ä¹™é›è¡é‡œæ»ç ç£é£¢å±¥è—¤è«¦è–¦æ­è›®æ‰±ä½³ç—´é…·æ‹¶è™¹è£•æ»å“ºå½è‡¼ç•¿ç›¾èœ‚æš‡å”†é ˆç²‹
èçªƒç¤é–‘åå¨¯éº—å´–å¦™ç²›ä¾å¯›çªŸä¼é‚£æ±šç’°æ†©æ€¨è²«ç­èŠ¯ç•œç¶±å¢³éœ²å®µè¨´éš·é€¸è™ä¸¼æ›‡è“‹æ†¶å¿ç…æ·‘è©”ç›—è¬è™œç‰²ç°¿è·¡ç‘ 
é½¢å‰¤æµ¦ç§©æ¨è¿­ç«¯æ…®æ±°æ³¡è¤’æˆ¿é›·å‡¹æ¿«è±ªæŠ„æ¸‡æ„‰å°‹æ®Šé…¬è”‘é “æººå¨˜å€’è‚˜è¼äºœè¨Ÿç´¡å€£æ„šè‰‡æ˜§ç½°å«é§†å©šæˆ¯ç¥‰é‚¸å°»çª¯
æœ½ç¨¿æ†¾å“€æ¡ƒåŠé­…é«„å¥‰çƒˆèŠé›Œç©è»Œæ•ç…™å¦¥è‘›æšéŸ»çµ¡å³ é£ç’§æ¹§æ—¦ç…©ç£¨éŒ¦æ¥¼æ³°éµè£¸æ¹¾è¡·äº«å©¿å¦ƒè¬„æ“¦ç‚‰èºç‹™å”ä¿¸é …æˆšæºèœœ
å”‡åˆ°æ‚©ä¾¶è–«çˆªäº­æ¼¬é€®è†³ä¸²æŠµç¶»åˆºæ®¿æ“ç™‚å‹…ç„ç´¯æ…ˆæ—‹å‰Šè›æ£æé¡åµå§“ç™’éœœå­”ä¿—é©šæ»æ½œå¡å³¡å³é‡£å­¤æå¥¨æ·«è¯é®å´åŸ·
æƒ¨ç •ç·»æ¬¾æ›½å½¼å¯¿å¡¾å°ç¿å„éœ‡ç´‹æŠŠç˜ä¼¸ç‚é¤“äº’ç´›å¸éµæŒŸæŒ¨é­‚æ‚£å¼§å³°å¦¨ç´«ç¬æŒ¯é»™å˜çˆµæ®´é–²å€¹æ‹­æ”»å¸½è¾¼çŒ¿æ›´æ±è‚ªç¯„è³¦
å‰é‡ˆç¤å¿Œéƒé‘‘ä¹¾æ‰•å”è¨—èƒç· é›¢ç¯¤ç“¦è¡¡å®´é«ªç¹­å£®ç”²ç›²æ´ç½·ç“¶å‡¸å¹½ç¿¼é£¾å¾éŠƒè‚©ç¦…æ¼†æ®‰åˆˆè„ŠèŒèª“é€”ç²—æ€’éš…è„šå–æ‚Ÿæ¬„å¾¡åŠ£
ç´¢å†¥å ¤ç²§å¼¦ç©æš«ç¶­æ¬è‚¯çŒ®è¾±èŠ³å‚²ç¼¶ç‹­éº»æ–½å°¼é¶´æ¿æ¡å‹ƒä½†ä»‹æº¶è—çŒŸè™æ‹“æ…¢å¡”æ™¶å™æµ®è·æ£Ÿå‚‘æ•¢ç‡¥æƒ§ç³§ç¦å¯©å¥ªè‘¬è»’æ®ç¹°
æ‹³æˆ’è´è…ºä¼äº€è¨ƒé…ªè„…é‚„æ¸‹å¦Šè²Œé€æ‚”è¬™èª˜ç¸›è†šé§„éš ç¨šè©°ç¸«ç›†é‹³é®æœ±ç¶²æ¬ºæ¶åŒ¹éª¸é˜»èµ¦æ¥·è²¼æ²¡æ³Šå……æ£„æ‰æ³Œåå‘ç·’è…•æ•æ±—
æ‹˜ç•è³œæ¡Ÿç¡å‰£ç—¢ç¥¥é€ƒå‹Ÿæ“¬å¯®å½±é›°è©³é…µèƒ´è«­å¹»ç–«é¿æšéœ€æƒè¸ªæ˜†èª‰æŒ¿åˆƒé¨å¼æ¦‚ä¾¯æ–—æ¤…è¾›èˆçœ åƒšé ƒæ¸¦ç¡æ±å ªçœ‰å˜²å‚µè–ªæŠ¹
ç’½æœ´å²¬æ‘‚åƒ…æ…„é—‡æ‹‰åŸ‹å¡Šä¾è‚Œæ»‘è“è³¢åƒ•å¥”ç™–æ‹™è˜çŸ›å¡šé•æµœç§Ÿè¨ºå·§ç‹©è¿«è³­è©®æ½°å†’å¥´é™¶å¸ç¿»æ°¾å½«ç¸æ³å …å¦„å´‡äº†é­é–å¸†
å¾ç²’å •éŠ˜æ˜æ–œå„ŸæŠæ¸¡æ æ­“æ†¤è¬¹æš¦æ¼«é‚ªæ­æ–¬çª®å˜±æ’²åµåº¶åˆ¹ç®¸ç‚ºå°½æ¶¼åŠ¾é­”è³‚é…å‡„æ†æ‰‰ç©‚å£Šç±å˜†æŸå“é¡•æ›–ç‰™æ£šè¥Ÿå¾®ç£é™°
æ¥é¯¨æ…æ—¬è«®æ­³å“²æµè‡´æ•·é›¶è—©è«¾å’²å‹¾
]]):gsub("%s", "")

data.jinmeiyo_kanji = ([[
ä¸‘ä¸ä¹ƒä¹‹ä¹ä¹Ÿäº‘äº˜äº™äº›äº¦äº¥äº¨äº®ä»”ä¼Šä¼ä¼½ä½ƒä½‘ä¼¶ä¾ƒä¾‘ä¿„ä¿ ä¿£ä¿å€­ä¿±å€¦å€–å²å‚­å„²å…å…å…œå…¶å†´å‡Œå‡œå‡›å‡§å‡ªå‡°å‡±å‡½åŠ‰åŠ«
å‹å‹ºå‹¿åŒåŒ¡å»¿åœå¯å¿å¨å©å‰å¡å¢å¶åªå¾åå»å“‰å“¨å•„å“©å–¬å–§å–°å–‹å˜©å˜‰å˜—å™Œå™‚åœƒåœ­åå°­å ¯å¦åŸ´å °å ºå µå¡™å£•å£¬å¤·å¥„å¥å¥—
å¨ƒå§ªå§¥å¨©å¬‰å­Ÿå®å®‹å®•å®¥å¯…å¯“å¯µå°–å°¤å±‘å³¨å³»å´šåµ¯åµ©å¶ºå·Œå·–å·²å·³å·´å·«å··å·½å¸–å¹Œå¹¡åº„åº‡åºšåºµå»Ÿå»»å¼˜å¼›å½—å½¦å½ªå½¬å¾ å¿½æ€œæ¢æ°
æ•æ‚ŒæƒŸæƒšæ‚‰æƒ‡æƒ¹æƒºæƒ£æ…§æ†æˆŠæˆ–æˆŸæ‰˜æŒ‰æŒºæŒ½æ¬æ²æ·æºæ§æ æƒæ‘‘æ‘ºæ’’æ’°æ’æ’­æ’«æ“¢å­œæ•¦æ–æ–¡æ–§æ–¯æ–¼æ—­æ˜‚æ˜Šæ˜æ˜Œæ˜´æ™æ™ƒæ™„
æ™’æ™‹æ™Ÿæ™¦æ™¨æ™ºæš‰æš¢æ›™æ›æ›³æœ‹æœ”ææ–æœææ­æµæ·æ‡æŸ‘æŸ´æŸ˜æŸŠæŸæŸ¾æŸšæ¡§æªœæ æ¡”æ¡‚æ –æ¡æ —æ¢§æ¢“æ¢¢æ¢›æ¢¯æ¡¶æ¢¶æ¤›æ¢æ£²æ¤‹æ¤€æ¥¯
æ¥šæ¥•æ¤¿æ¥ æ¥“æ¤°æ¥¢æ¥Šæ¦æ¨ºæ¦Šæ¦›æ§™æ§‡æ§æ§Œæ¨«æ§»æ¨Ÿæ¨‹æ©˜æ¨½æ©™æªæª€æ«‚æ«›æ«“æ¬£æ¬½æ­æ­¤æ®†æ¯…æ¯˜æ¯¬æ±€æ±æ±æ±²æ²Œæ²“æ²«æ´¸æ´²æ´µæ´›æµ©æµ¬
æ·µæ·³æ¸šæ¸šæ·€æ·‹æ¸¥æ¹˜æ¹Šæ¹›æº¢æ»‰æºœæ¼±æ¼•æ¼£æ¾ªæ¿¡ç€•ç˜ç¸ç¼çƒç„°ç„šç…Œç…¤ç…‰ç†™ç‡•ç‡ç‡¦ç‡­ç‡¿çˆ¾ç‰’ç‰Ÿç‰¡ç‰½çŠ€ç‹¼çŒªçŒªç…ç–ç‚çˆçŠç€
ç²ç¢ç¢ç‰ç‘›ç¥ç¶çµç³ç‘šç‘ç‘¶ç‘³ç“œç“¢ç”¥ç”«ç• ç•¢ç–‹ç–çšçš“çœ¸ç¥çŸ©ç ¦ç ¥ç §ç¡¯ç¢“ç¢—ç¢©ç¢§ç£ç£¯ç¥‡ç¥¢ç¦°ç¥ç¥ç¥·ç¦±ç¦„ç¥¿ç¦ç¦ç¦½ç¦¾
ç§¦ç§¤ç¨€ç¨”ç¨Ÿç¨œç©£ç©°ç©¹ç©¿çª„çªªçªºç«£ç«ªç«ºç«¿ç¬ˆç¬¹ç¬™ç¬ ç­ˆç­‘ç®•ç®”ç¯‡ç¯ ç°ç°¾ç±¾ç²¥ç²Ÿç³Šç´˜ç´—ç´çµƒç´¬çµ†çµ¢ç¶ºç¶œç¶´ç·‹ç¶¾ç¶¸ç¸å¾½ç¹«
ç¹¡çº‚çºç¾šç¿”ç¿ è€€è€Œè€¶è€½è¡è‚‡è‚‹è‚´èƒ¤èƒ¡è„©è…”è„¹è†è‡¥èˆœèˆµèŠ¥èŠ¹èŠ­èŠ™èŠ¦è‹‘èŒ„è‹”è‹ºèŒ…èŒ‰èŒ¸èŒœèè»è«è‰è…è«è–è„è©èŒè èŠè±
è‘¦è‘µè±è‘ºè©è‘£è‘¡è“‘è’”è’è’¼è’²è’™è“‰è“®è”­è”£è”¦è“¬è”“è•è•¨è•‰è•ƒè•ªè–™è•¾è•—è—è–©è˜‡è˜­è¦è¶èºèŸ¬èŸ¹è Ÿè¡¿è¢ˆè¢´è£¡è£Ÿè£³è¥–è¨Šè¨£è¨»è©¢
è©«èª¼è«è«„è«’è¬‚è«ºè®ƒè±¹è²°è³‘èµ³è·¨è¹„è¹Ÿè¼”è¼¯è¼¿è½Ÿè¾°è¾»è¿‚è¿„è¾¿è¿ªè¿¦é€™é€é€—é€¢é¥é™éé¼é‚‘ç¥éƒé„­é…‰é†‡é†é†é†¬é‡‰é‡˜é‡§éŠ‘é‹’é‹¸
éŒ˜éŒéŒ†éŒ«é¬é§é–ƒé–é–¤é˜¿é™€éšˆéš¼é›€é›é››é›«éœé–é„éé˜é é­é é Œé —é¡šé¢¯é¥—é¦¨é¦´é¦³é§•é§¿é©é­é­¯é®é¯‰é¯›é°¯é±’é±—é³©é³¶é³³é´¨é´»
éµœéµ¬é·—é·²é·ºé·¹éº’éºŸéº¿é»é»›é¼
äºæƒ¡çˆ²æ¦®è¡åœ“ç·£è–—æ‡‰æ«»å¥§æ©«æº«åƒ¹å£æ‡·æ¨‚æ¸´å·é™·å¯¬æ°£åƒæˆ²è™›å³½ç‹¹æ›‰
é§ˆå‹³è–°æƒ æ­é·„è—æ“Šç¸£å„‰åŠéšªåœˆæª¢é¡¯é©—åš´å»£æ†é»ƒåœ‹é»‘ç¢é›œå…’æ¿•å¯¦å£½æ”¶å¾æ¾ç¸ç¸±ç·–æ•
å°‡æ¶‰ç‡’å¥¬æ¢ç‹€ä¹˜æ·¨å‰©ç–Šå­ƒè®“é‡€çœå¯¢æ„¼ç›¡ç²¹é†‰ç©—ç€¨é½Šéœæ”å°ˆæˆ°çº–ç¦ªå£¯çˆ­èŠæœå·¢æ›¾è£ç˜¦é¨·å¢è—è‡Ÿå½å¸¶
æ»¯ç€§å–®åœ˜å½ˆæ™é‘„å»³å¾µè½é­è½‰å‚³å¶‹ç‡ˆç›œç¨»å¾·æ‹œç›ƒè³£é«®æ‹”æ™šç¥•å†¨æ‹‚ä½›æ­¥å³¯é£œ
æ¯è¬é»˜åŸœå½Œè—¥èˆ‡æ–æ¨£è¬ ä¾†è³´è¦½é¾å‡‰ç¶ æ·šå£˜ç¦®æ›†æ­·éŠéƒéŒ„]]):gsub("%s", "")

return data

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="143">
<source>wikt/translit/ja/k2r-old.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local data = mw.loadData("ja/data")

function export.kana_to_romaji(text, nodiacr, keepdot)
    if type(text) == "table" then -- assume a frame.
        text, nodiacr = text.args[1], text.args[2]
    end

    -- remove %
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "%%", "")

    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "%^'''", "'''^")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "%^ ", " ^")

    -- local kr_minus_period = data.kr
    -- kr_minus_period["ã€‚"] = "ã€‚"

    -- convert Japanese spaces to western spaces
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ã€€", " ")

    -- if there is a ã¯ separated by halfwidth spaces, romanize it as " wa "
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¯ ", " wa ")
    -- also if it follows a space and is the last character, e.g. ãã‚Œã§ã¯
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¯$", " wa")
    -- or " ã¯ã€"
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¯ã€", " wa, ")
    -- or " ã¯ã€‚"
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¯ã€‚", " wa. ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¯ï¼Ÿ", " wa? ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¯ï¼‰", " wa)")
    -- or " '''ã¯''' "
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " '''ã¯''' ", " '''wa''' ")
    -- romanize ã§ã¯ as "dewa"
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã§ã¯ ", " dewa ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã§ã¯$", " dewa")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã§ã¯ã€", " dewa, ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã§ã¯ã€‚", " dewa. ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã§ã¯ï¼Ÿ", " dewa? ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã§ã¯ï¼‰", " dewa)")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "'''ã§ã¯'''", "'''dewa'''")
    -- romanize ã§ ã¯ (with space) as "de wa"
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "'''ã§ ã¯'''", "'''de wa'''")
    -- same sort of thing for ã¸
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¸ ", " e ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " '''ã¸''' ", " '''e''' ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¸$", " e")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¸ã€", " e, ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¸ã€‚", " e. ")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¸ï¼Ÿ", " e?")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " ã¸ï¼‰", " e)")
    -- dangling small tsu is romanized as <s>nothing</s> apostrophe
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "[ãƒƒã£]ã€‚", "&apos;ã€‚")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "[ãƒƒã£]ï¼", "&apos;ï¼")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "[ãƒƒã£]ã€", "&apos;ã€")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "[ãƒƒã£]ã€", "&apos;ã€")

    -- ã‚ means "repeat the previous character" and is used with hiragana, like ã€… is for kanji
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "(.)ã‚", "%1%1")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "(.)ã‚", function(char) return mw.ustring.toNFC(char .. char .. "ã‚™") end)

    -- romanising ãƒ¶
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒ¶ã’ã¤", "kagetsu")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒ¶", "ga")

    -- convert hiragana to katakana
    text = require("ja").hira_to_kata(text)
    -- replace katakana with romaji (?? not sure what the pattern below does ??)
    -- this is hackish, but we're using the period to indicate morpheme boundaries to prevent macrons
    -- from forming across them, so we'll remove the ASCII periods used for markup but not the Japanese periods

    -- convert the Japanese periods at the end
    -- table.remove(kr_minus_period, "ã€‚")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".[ã‚£ã‚§ã‚©ãƒ£ãƒ¥ãƒ§ã‚¡ãƒ®ã‚¥ã‚œ]?ã‚§?", function(char)
        if char == "ã€‚" then
            return char
        else
            return data.kr_old[char] or char
        end
    end)

    text = require("ja").fullwidth_to_halfwidth(text)

    -- replace long vowel mark with the vowel that comes before
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "([aeiou])ãƒ¼", "%1%1")

    -- add vowels with diacritics
    if not nodiacr then
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "oo", "Å")
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "aa", "Ä")
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ee", "Ä“")
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ou", "Å")
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "uu", "Å«")
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ii", "Ä«")
    end

    if not keepdot then
        -- if input had spaces, keep them
        -- if the input string had periods, then remove them now
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "%.", "")
        -- now that markup periods are gone, convert the Japanese periods to western periods
        text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ã€‚", ". ")
    end

    -- 
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "â—‡â—†", "")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "â—†â—‡", "")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " *â—† *", "")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " *â—‡ *", " ")

    -- romanize sokuon or geminate consonants
    -- text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, '^ãƒƒ', '')
    -- double the previous consonant letter if there is a small tsu
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒƒ([kstpgdbjzrfh])", "%1%1")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒƒ'''([kstpgdbjzrfh])", "%1'''%1")
    -- replace ãƒƒc with tc
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒƒc", "tc")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒƒ'''c", "t'''c")
    -- if small tsu comes at the end, just throw it away
    -- text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, 'ãƒƒ$', '')

    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "ãƒƒ", "&apos;")

    -- the @ is used to determine when to insert an opostrophe after ã‚“ or ãƒ³
    -- (all is kata at that point)
    -- insert apostrophe when ãƒ³ is followed by a vowel or
    -- y, which corresponds to the cases ã‚“ã‚„ (n'ya) ã‚“ã‚† (n'yu) and ã‚“ã‚ˆ (n'yo)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "@([aeiouÄÄ“Ä«ÅÅ«y])", "'%1")
    -- remove @
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "@", "")

    -- capitalize any letter following a ^ symbol
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "%^%l", mw.ustring.upper)
    -- remove ^
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "%^", "")

    -- clean up spaces
    text = mw.text.trim(text)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, " +", " ")

    text = mw.ustring.toNFC(text)

    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="144">
<source>wikt/translit/ja.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local titleObj = mw.title.getCurrentTitle()
local pagename = titleObj.text
local namespace = titleObj.nsText

local str_gsub = string.gsub
local find = mw.ustring.find
local length = mw.ustring.len
local trim = mw.text.trim
local split = mw.text.split
local sub, gsub = mw.ustring.sub, mw.ustring.gsub
local match, gmatch = mw.ustring.match, mw.ustring.gmatch
local to_cp, to_char = mw.ustring.codepoint, mw.ustring.char

local Jpan = require("scripts").getByCode("Jpan")
local lang = require("languages").getByCode("ja")

-- note that arrays loaded by mw.loadData cannot be directly used by gsub
local data = mw.loadData("ja/data")

-- Unicode normalization often converts these to the corresponding CJK Unified Ideographs characters
local compat_ideo = mw.ustring.char(0xF900) .. "-" .. mw.ustring.char(0xFAD9)

export.data = {joyo_kanji = data.joyo_kanji, jinmeiyo_kanji = data.jinmeiyo_kanji, grade1 = data.grade1, grade2 = data.grade2, grade3 = data.grade3, grade4 = data.grade4, grade5 = data.grade5, grade6 = data.grade6}

local function track(code)
    if type(code) ~= "string" then error("The track function requires a string as argument.") end
    require("debug").track("ja/" .. code)
end

local function change_codepoint(added_value) return function(char) return to_char(to_cp(char) + added_value) end end

function export.hira_to_kata(text)
    if type(text) == "table" then text = text.args[1] end

    return (gsub(gsub(text, "[ã-ã‚–]", change_codepoint(96)), "[ğ›…-ğ›…’]", change_codepoint(20)))
end

function export.kata_to_hira(text)
    if type(text) == "table" then text = text.args[1] end

    return (gsub(gsub(text, "[ã‚¡-ãƒ¶]", change_codepoint(-96)), "[ğ›…¤-ğ›…¦]", change_codepoint(-20)))
end

function export.fullwidth_to_halfwidth(text)
    if type(text) == "table" then text = text.args[1] end

    text = gsub(text, "ã€€", " ")
    return (gsub(text, "[ï¼-ï½]", change_codepoint(-65248)))
end

function export.kana_to_romaji(text, options)
    -- options: no_diacritics, keep_period, hist, phonetic
    local str_find = string.find

    if type(text) == "table" then text = text.args[1] end

    if not options then options = {} end

    -- conversions
    if not options.phonetic then
        text = gsub(text, "(%-)([ã¯ãƒ])$", "%1ãŠŸãˆ›ãŠŸ%2") -- ã¯ as suffix (æ´¾ "-ha", etc.) and appearing at the end of string
        text = gsub(text, "(%-)([ã¯ãƒ]) ", "%1ãŠŸãˆ›ãŠŸ%2 ") -- ã¯ as suffix and appearing mid-sentence
    end

    text = str_gsub(text, "ï¼…", "ãŠŸãŒ«ãŠŸ") -- at [[è¦‹è¾¼ã‚€]], for example; avoid collision with % used in our ruby syntax
    text = str_gsub(text, "'''", "ãŠŸâ’ãŠŸ")
    text = str_gsub(text, "<u>", "ãŠŸã‹‘â’°ãŠŸ")
    text = str_gsub(text, "</u>", "ãŠŸã‹ºâ’°ãŠŸ")

    local text_styling = "ãŠŸ[ã‹‘ã‹ºâ’â’°]+ãŠŸ"

    -- avoid tampering with existing latin text: store it away
    local escape = {}
    local id = 0
    for latin in string.gmatch(text, "[a-z]+") do
        escape[id] = latin
        text = str_gsub(text, latin, "ãŠŸãŠ•ãŠ•ãŠŸ" .. id .. "ãŠŸãŠ•ãŠ•ãŠŸ")
        id = id + 1
    end

    -- special preformatting
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãƒ¶ã’ã¤", "ã‹ã’ã¤")
    text = gsub(text, "ãƒ¶(" .. text_styling .. ")ã’ã¤", "ã‹%1ã’ã¤") -- ã€Œ'''ãƒ¶'''ã’ã¤ã€
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãƒ¶", "ãŒ")
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãƒµ", "ã‹")
    text = gsub(text, "(.)[ã‚ãƒ½]", "%1%1")
    text = gsub(text, "(.)[ã‚ãƒ¾]", function(char) return mw.ustring.toNFC(char .. char .. "ã‚™") end) -- unicode hax

    -- [[Wiktionary:Grease_pit/2017/May#Formatting_for_individual_Japanese_readings]]
    if options.hist then
        text = gsub(text, "[ã‚„ã‚†ã‚ˆã‚ã‚ã‚‘ã‚’]", "ãŠŸâ’³ãŠŸ%0")
        text = gsub(text, ".", {["ã—"] = "si", ["ã˜"] = "zi", ["ã¡"] = "ti", ["ã¢"] = "di", ["ã¤"] = "tu", ["ã¥"] = "du", ["ğ›€"] = "ye", ["ğ›€†"] = "yi", ["ã‚"] = "wi", ["ã‚’"] = "wo"})
    end

    text = export.hira_to_kata(text)
    text = gsub(text, ".", data.kr)
    text = export.fullwidth_to_halfwidth(text)

    if options.hist then
        text = str_gsub(text, "oo", "o.o")
        text = str_gsub(text, "ou", "o.u")
        text = str_gsub(text, "h", "f")

        local old = text
        text = str_gsub(text, "iãŠŸâ’³ãŠŸy", "y") -- ãã‚ã‚„ã† kwyau
        text = str_gsub(text, "([kg])uãŠŸâ’³ãŠŸw", "%1w")
        if old ~= text then
            --[=[
				There may be cases in which i or u is deleted incorrectly, and a
				period should be inserted.
				"Syncope" isn't quite accurate, as there wasn't a sound change.
				It's just an orthographic convention.
				[[Special:WhatLinksHere/Template:tracking/ja/mora syncope]]
			]=]
            -- mw.log(str_gsub(old, 'ãŠŸâ’³ãŠŸ', '')  .. ' â†’ ' .. str_gsub(text, 'ãŠŸâ’³ãŠŸ', '') )
            track("mora syncope")
        end

        text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸâ’³ãŠŸ", "") -- ã‚‘ã¤ wetsu
    end

    -- markup
    text = str_gsub(text, "%%", ".") -- ruby "percent sign" syntax
    text = gsub(text, "([ãƒƒÂ¤])%.", "%1") -- ã€Œã— ã‚’ ã¼ã£.ã™ã€; ã€Œã‚‹ã„%ã˜ã‚“%ãˆã‚“ã€â†’ã€Œrui.jinÂ¤.enÂ¤ã€

    -- ã€Œãƒ†ã‚§ã‚§ã‚§ã€â†’ã€Œãƒ†ã‚§ãƒ¼ãƒ¼ã€ (avoid funky romaji effected by the "(ãƒ†ãƒ¥â†’)teãƒ¦â†’tyu" line below)
    local kogaki_vowels = {"ã‚¡", "ã‚£", "ã‚¥", "ã‚§", "ã‚©"}
    for _, char in ipairs(kogaki_vowels) do text = gsub(text, "(" .. char .. ")(" .. char .. "+)", function(a, b) return a .. mw.ustring.rep("ãƒ¼", length(b)) end) end

    -- (ã‚²ã‚§â†’)geã‚§â†’gee (note that this causes things like ã‚¦ã‚¥â†’Å« and ã‚®ã‚£â†’gÄ«)
    text = gsub(text, "[aiueo][ã‚¡ã‚£ã‚¥ã‚§ã‚©]", {["aã‚¡"] = "aa", ["iã‚£"] = "ii", ["uã‚¥"] = "uu", ["eã‚§"] = "ee", ["oã‚©"] = "oo"})

    -- (ã‚¯ãƒ®â†’)kuãƒ®â†’kwa, (ã‚¯ğ›…¤â†’)kuğ›…¤â†’kwi, (ã‚¯ğ›…¥â†’)kuğ›…¥â†’kwe, (ã‚¯ğ›…¦â†’)kuğ›…¦â†’kwo
    text = gsub(text, "[uo]([ãƒ®ğ›…¤ğ›…¥ğ›…¦])", {["ãƒ®"] = "wa", ["ğ›…¤"] = "wi", ["ğ›…¥"] = "we", ["ğ›…¦"] = "wo"})

    -- (ã‚¯ã‚¡â†’)kuã‚¡â†’kwa, (ãƒˆã‚¡â†’)toã‚¡â†’twa, (ã‚¦ã‚£â†’)uã‚£â†’wi
    text = gsub(text, "[uo]([ã‚¡ã‚£ã‚§ã‚©])", {["ã‚¡"] = "wa", ["ã‚£"] = "wi", ["ã‚§"] = "we", ["ã‚©"] = "wo"})
    if not options.hist then
        -- (ãƒ„ã‚¡â†’)cwaâ†’ca
        text = str_gsub(text, "([fvcsz])w", "%1")
    end

    -- (ãƒ†ãƒ¥â†’)teãƒ¦â†’tyu, (ã‚®ã‚§â†’)giã‚§â†’gye
    text = gsub(text, "[aiueo]([ãƒ£ãƒ¥ã‚§ãƒ§])", {["ãƒ£"] = "ya", ["ãƒ¥"] = "yu", ["ã‚§"] = "ye", ["ãƒ§"] = "yo"})
    -- (ã‚¸ãƒ¥â†’)jyuâ†’ju
    text = gsub(text, "([xjq])y", "%1")

    -- (ãƒ†ã‚£â†’)teã‚£â†’ti (essentially forget about the vowel in between)
    text = gsub(text, "[aiueo]([ã‚¡ã‚£ã‚¥ã‚§ã‚©])", {["ã‚¡"] = "a", ["ã‚£"] = "i", ["ã‚¥"] = "u", ["ã‚§"] = "e", ["ã‚©"] = "o"})

    -- chouonpu and sokuon
    while str_find(text, "[aiueo]ãƒ¼") or str_find(text, "ãƒƒ *[bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxyz]") or find(text, "ãƒƒ" .. text_styling .. "[bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxyz]") do
        text = str_gsub(text, "([aiueo])ãƒ¼", "%1%1")
        text = str_gsub(text, "ãƒƒ( *)([bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxyz])", "%2%1%2")
        text = gsub(text, "ãƒƒ(" .. text_styling .. ")([bcdfghjklmnpqrstvwxyz])", "%2%1%2")
    end
    -- deal with leftover sokuon not used as geminate
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãƒƒ", "&#39;") -- Apostrophe

    -- (ã‚“â†’)nÂ¤
    text = str_gsub(text, "Â¤([aiueoy])", "'%1")
    text = str_gsub(text, "Â¤", "")

    -- ã¯, ã¸
    if not options.phonetic and str_find(text, "h[ae]") then
        for i, v in ipairs {{"ha", "wa"}, {"he", "e"}} do
            local thingy = "[^a-z.ãŠŸ-]" -- not sure what this should be named
            text = gsub(text, "(" .. thingy .. ")" .. v[1] .. "(" .. thingy .. ")", "%1" .. v[2] .. "%2")
            text = gsub(text, "(" .. thingy .. ")" .. v[1] .. "$", "%1" .. v[2])
            text = gsub(text, "^" .. v[1] .. "(" .. thingy .. ")", v[2] .. "%1")
            if find(text, text_styling) then
                text = gsub(text, "(" .. thingy .. ")" .. v[1] .. "(" .. text_styling .. thingy .. ")", "%1" .. v[2] .. "%2")
                text = gsub(text, "(" .. thingy .. ")" .. v[1] .. "(" .. text_styling .. ")$", "%1" .. v[2] .. "%2")
                text = gsub(text, "(" .. thingy .. text_styling .. ")" .. v[1] .. "(" .. text_styling .. thingy .. ")", "%1" .. v[2] .. "%2")
                text = gsub(text, "(" .. thingy .. text_styling .. ")" .. v[1] .. "(" .. text_styling .. ")$", "%1" .. v[2] .. "%2")
            end
        end
    end
    -- change only when
    --   â‘  not flanked by a-z or a period ("^sore wa nani$", "^hyappou no .he hitotsu$")
    --   â‘¡ at the end of the string and not preceded by a-z or a period ("^are wa$")
    --   â‘¢ at the beginning of the string and not followed by a-z or a period ("^he ikou$") [not sure this is actually necessary, but I suppose it is consistent with â‘¡]
    -- this also means that "^ha$" becomes "ha"
    -- period can be used next to the kana (either side) to force the "dumb" romanization (i.e. "ha", "he")

    -- fix sh, ch, ts
    local function handle_digraphs(geminate, intervening, main, following)
        -- ã€Œã‚ã¡ã‚ƒã€â†’ã€Œmechaã€
        -- ã€Œã‚ã£ã¡ã‚ƒã€â†’ã€Œmetchaã€
        -- ã€Œã‚ã£ã£ã¡ã‚ƒã€â†’ã€Œmettchaã€
        local corresp_geminate_form = {["x"] = "s", ["q"] = "t", ["c"] = "t"}
        local corresp_main = {["x"] = "sh", ["q"] = "ch", ["c"] = "ts"}

        local geminate_repl, main_repl

        -- So as not to convert ch to tsh.
        if not following or main .. following ~= "ch" then main_repl = corresp_main[main] end

        if geminate ~= "" then geminate_repl = string.rep(corresp_geminate_form[main], #geminate) end

        return (geminate_repl or geminate) .. (intervening or "") .. (main_repl or main) .. (following or "")
    end

    local function handle_digraphs2(geminate, main, following) return handle_digraphs(geminate, nil, main, following) end

    text = gsub(text, "([xqc]+)(" .. text_styling .. ")([xqc])", handle_digraphs)
    text = gsub(text, "([xqc]*)([xqc])(.?)", handle_digraphs2)

    -- macrons
    -- Will cause problems if combined vowel-macron characters are used below.
    if not options.no_diacritics then
        if not options.phonetic then text = str_gsub(text, "ou", "Å") end
        local macron = to_char(0x304)
        text = str_gsub(text, "([oaeui])%1", "%1" .. macron)
    end

    -- remove markup and convert real periods
    if not options.keep_period then
        text = str_gsub(text, "%.", "")
        text = str_gsub(text, "ã€‚", "â—†.â—‡")
    end

    --
    text = str_gsub(text, "â—‡â—†", "")
    text = str_gsub(text, "â—†â—‡", "")
    text = str_gsub(text, " *â—† *", "")
    text = str_gsub(text, " *â—‡ *", " ")

    -- restore latin text
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸãŠ•ãŠ•ãŠŸ(%d+)ãŠŸãŠ•ãŠ•ãŠŸ", function(id) return escape[tonumber(id)] end)

    -- clean up spaces
    text = trim(text)
    text = str_gsub(text, " +", " ")

    -- remove double ampersands used in ruby
    text = str_gsub(text, "&&(.-)&&", "%1")

    -- uppercase markup
    text = str_gsub(text, "(%^)(ãŠŸâ’ãŠŸ)", "%2%1") -- move ^ to an effective position if placed before bold markup
    text = str_gsub(text, "(%^)( )", "%2%1") -- same but with spaces
    text = gsub(text, "%^(.)", mw.ustring.upper) -- uppercase conversion

    -- clean up spaces again
    text = str_gsub(text, " +", " ")

    -- conversions
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸâ’ãŠŸ", "'''")
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸã‹‘â’°ãŠŸ", "<u>")
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸã‹ºâ’°ãŠŸ", "</u>")
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸãˆ›ãŠŸ", "")
    text = str_gsub(text, "ãŠŸãŒ«ãŠŸ", "%%")

    -- unicode NFC
    text = mw.ustring.toNFC(text)

    if find(text, "[ã-ãƒ¼]") then track("k2r failure") end

    return text
end

-- removes spaces and hyphens from input
-- intended to be used when checking manual romaji to allow the
-- insertion of spaces or hyphens in manual romaji without appearing "wrong"
function export.rm_spaces_hyphens(f)
    local text = type(f) == "table" and f.args[1] or f
    text = str_gsub(text, ".", {[" "] = "", ["-"] = "", ["."] = "", ["'"] = ""})
    text = str_gsub(text, "&nbsp;", "")
    return text
end

function export.romaji_to_kata(f)
    local text = type(f) == "table" and f.args[1] or f
    text = gsub(text, ".", data.rd)
    text = str_gsub(text, "(.)%1", {k = "ãƒƒk", s = "ãƒƒs", t = "ãƒƒt", p = "ãƒƒp", b = "ãƒƒb", d = "ãƒƒd", g = "ãƒƒg", j = "ãƒƒj"})
    text = str_gsub(text, "tc", "ãƒƒc")
    text = str_gsub(text, "tsyu", "ãƒ„ãƒ¥")
    text = str_gsub(text, "ts[uoiea]", {["tsu"] = "ãƒ„", ["tso"] = "ãƒ„ã‚©", ["tsi"] = "ãƒ„ã‚£", ["tse"] = "ãƒ„ã‚§", ["tsa"] = "ãƒ„ã‚¡"})
    text = str_gsub(text, "sh[uoiea]", {["shu"] = "ã‚·ãƒ¥", ["sho"] = "ã‚·ãƒ§", ["shi"] = "ã‚·", ["she"] = "ã‚·ã‚§", ["sha"] = "ã‚·ãƒ£"})
    text = str_gsub(text, "ch[uoiea]", {["chu"] = "ãƒãƒ¥", ["cho"] = "ãƒãƒ§", ["chi"] = "ãƒ", ["che"] = "ãƒã‚§", ["cha"] = "ãƒãƒ£"})
    text = str_gsub(text, "n[uoiea']?", {["nu"] = "ãƒŒ", ["no"] = "ãƒ", ["ni"] = "ãƒ‹", ["ne"] = "ãƒ", ["na"] = "ãƒŠ"})
    text = str_gsub(text, "[wvtrpsnmlkjhgfdbzy][yw]?[uoiea]", data.rk)
    text = str_gsub(text, "n'?", "ãƒ³")
    text = str_gsub(text, "[aeiou]", {u = "ã‚¦", o = "ã‚ª", i = "ã‚¤", e = "ã‚¨", a = "ã‚¢"})
    return text
end

-- expects: any mix of kanji and kana
-- determines the script types used
-- e.g. given ã‚¤ã‚®ãƒªã‚¹äºº, it returns Kana+Hani
function export.script(f)
    text, script = type(f) == "table" and f.args[1] or f, {}

    if find(text, "[ã-ã‚–]") or find(text, "[ğ›…-ğ›…’]") then table.insert(script, "Hira") end
    -- TODO: there are two kanas.  This should insert Kata.
    if find(text, "[ã‚¡-ãƒºãƒ¼]") or find(text, "[ğ›…¤-ğ›…¦]") then table.insert(script, "Kana") end
    -- ä¸€ is unicode 4e00, previously used ä¸ is 4e01
    if find(text, "[ã€-ä¶µä¸€-é¿Œ" .. compat_ideo .. "ğ €€-ğ¯¨Ÿ]") then table.insert(script, "Hani") end
    -- matching %a should have worked but matched the end of every string
    if find(text, "[a-zA-ZÄÄ“Ä«ÅÅ«Ä€Ä’ÄªÅŒÅªï½-ï½šï¼¡-ï¼º]") then table.insert(script, "Romaji") end
    if find(text, "[0-9ï¼-ï¼™]") then table.insert(script, "Number") end
    if find(text, "[ã€†ã€…]") then table.insert(script, "Abbreviation") end

    return table.concat(script, "+")
end

-- when counting morae, most small hiragana belong to the previous mora,
-- so for purposes of counting them, they can be removed and the characters
-- can be counted to get the number of morae.  The exception is small tsu,
-- so data.nonmora_to_empty maps all small hiragana except small tsu.
function export.count_morae(text)
    if type(text) == "table" then text = text.args[1] end
    -- convert kata to hira (hira is untouched)
    text = export.kata_to_hira(text)
    -- remove all of the small hiragana such as ã‚‡ except small tsu
    text = gsub(text, ".", data.nonmora_to_empty)
    -- remove zero-width spaces
    text = gsub(text, "â€", "")
    -- return number of characters, which should be the number of morae
    return length(text)
end

-- accepts: any mix of kana
-- returns: a hiragana sort key designed for WMF software
-- this is like sort() but doesn't return |sort=sortkey,
-- just the sort key itself, but unlike sort(), this
-- replaces the long vowel mark with its vowel
function export.jsort(text)
    if type(text) == "table" then text = text.args[1] end
    local textsub = ""
    local convertedten = ""
    local result = ""
    local len = 1

    -- remove western spaces, hyphens, and periods
    -- diff=41967612: also remove caret
    text = gsub(text, "[ %-%.%^]", "")

    text = export.kata_to_hira(text)

    -- if the first character has dakuten, replace it with the corresponding
    -- character without dakuten and add an apostrophe to the end, e.g.
    -- ãŒã™ > ã‹ã™'
    if gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.dakuten) == "" then
        len = length(text)
        textsub = sub(text, 2, len)
        convertedten = gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.tenconv)
        text = (convertedten .. textsub .. "'")
    else
        -- similar thing but with handuken and two apostrophes, e.g. ã±ã™ -> ã¯ã™''
        if gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.handakuten) == "" then
            len = length(text)
            textsub = sub(text, 2, len)
            convertedten = gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.tenconv)
            text = (convertedten .. textsub .. "''")
        end
    end
    -- replace the long vowel mark with the vowel that it stands for
    for key, value in pairs(data.longvowels) do text = gsub(text, key, value) end
    return text
end

-- returns a sort key with |sort= in front, e.g.
-- |sort=ã¯ã¤ãã‚“' if given ã°ã¤ãã‚“
function export.sort(f)
    local text = type(f) == "table" and f.args[1] or f
    local textsub = ""
    local convertedten = ""
    local result = ""
    local len = 1
    local kyreplace = ""
    kyreplace = gsub(text, "[ã‚¡-ãƒº]", "")
    if kyreplace == "" then result = ("|" .. "sort" .. "=") end
    text = export.kata_to_hira(text)
    if gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.dakuten) == "" then
        if kyreplace == "" then
        else
            result = ("|" .. "sort" .. "=")
        end
        len = length(text)
        textsub = sub(text, 2, len)
        convertedten = gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.tenconv)
        result = (result .. convertedten .. textsub .. "'")
    else
        if gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.handakuten) == "" then
            if kyreplace == "" then
            else
                result = ("|" .. "sort" .. "=")
            end
            len = length(text)
            textsub = sub(text, 2, len)
            convertedten = gsub(sub(text, 1, 1), ".", data.tenconv)
            result = (result .. convertedten .. textsub .. "''")
        else
            if kyreplace == "" then result = (result .. text) end
        end
    end
    return result
end

-- returns the "stem" of a verb or -i adjective, that is the term minus the final character
function export.definal(f) return sub(f.args[1], 1, (length(f.args[1]) - 1)) end

function export.remove_ruby_markup(text) return (string.gsub(text, "[%^%-%. %%]", "")) end

-- do the work of Template:ja-kanji
function export.kanji(frame)
    local pagename = mw.title.getCurrentTitle().text
    -- only do this if this entry is a kanji page and not some user's page
    if namespace == "" then
        local params = {grade = {}, rs = {}, shin = {}, kyu = {}, head = {}}
        local args = require("parameters").process(frame:getParent().args, params)

        local rs = args["rs"] or require("zh-sortkey").makeSortKey(pagename, "ja")
        local shin = args["shin"]
        local kyu = args["kyu"]
        local head = args["head"]

        local grade_replacements = {["c"] = 7, ["n"] = 8, ["uc"] = 9, ["r"] = 0}
        local grade = tonumber(args["grade"]) or args["grade"]
        grade = grade_replacements[grade] or grade

        local wikitext = {}
        local categories = {}

        local catsort = rs or pagename

        -- display the kanji itself at the top at 275% size
        table.insert(wikitext, "<div><span lang=\"ja\" class=\"Jpan\" style=\"font-size:275%; line-height:1;\">" .. (args["head"] or pagename) .. "</span></div>")

        -- display information for the grade

        -- if grade was not specified, determine it now
        if not grade then grade = export.kanji_grade(pagename) end

        local in_parenthesis = {}
        local grade_links = {[1] = "[[w:KyÅiku kanji|grade 1 â€œKyÅikuâ€ kanji]]", [2] = "[[w:KyÅiku kanji|grade 2 â€œKyÅikuâ€ kanji]]", [3] = "[[w:KyÅiku kanji|grade 3 â€œKyÅikuâ€ kanji]]", [4] = "[[w:KyÅiku kanji|grade 4 â€œKyÅikuâ€ kanji]]", [5] = "[[w:KyÅiku kanji|grade 5 â€œKyÅikuâ€ kanji]]", [6] = "[[w:KyÅiku kanji|grade 6 â€œKyÅikuâ€ kanji]]", [7] = "[[w:JÅyÅ kanji|common â€œJÅyÅâ€ kanji]]", [8] = "[[w:JinmeiyÅ kanji|â€œJinmeiyÅâ€ kanji used for names]]", [9] = "[[w:HyÅgai kanji|uncommon â€œHyÅgaiâ€ kanji]]", [0] = "[[w:Radical_(Chinese_character)|Radical]]"}
        if grade_links[grade] then
            table.insert(in_parenthesis, grade_links[grade])
        else
            table.insert(categories, "[[Category:Japanese kanji missing grade|" .. catsort .. "]]")
        end

        -- link to shinjitai if shinjitai was specified, and link to kyujitai if kyujitai was specified

        if kyu then
            table.insert(in_parenthesis, "[[shinjitai]] kanji, [[kyÅ«jitai]] form <span lang=\"ja\" class=\"Jpan\">[[" .. kyu .. "#Japanese|" .. kyu .. "]]</span>")
        elseif shin then
            table.insert(in_parenthesis, "[[kyÅ«jitai]] kanji, [[shinjitai]] form <span lang=\"ja\" class=\"Jpan\">[[" .. shin .. "#Japanese|" .. shin .. "]]</span>")
        end
        table.insert(wikitext, "''(" .. table.concat(in_parenthesis, ",&nbsp;") .. "'')")

        -- add categories
        table.insert(categories, "[[Category:Japanese Han characters|" .. catsort .. "]]")
        local grade_categories = {[1] = "Grade 1 kanji", [2] = "Grade 2 kanji", [3] = "Grade 3 kanji", [4] = "Grade 4 kanji", [5] = "Grade 5 kanji", [6] = "Grade 6 kanji", [7] = "Common kanji", [8] = "Kanji used for names", [9] = "Uncommon kanji", [0] = "CJKV radicals"}
        table.insert(categories, "[[Category:" .. (grade_categories[grade] or error("The grade " .. grade .. " is invalid.")) .. "|" .. (grade == "0" and " " or catsort) .. "]]")

        -- error category
        if not rs then table.insert(categories, "[[Category:Japanese kanji missing radical and strokes]]") end

        return table.concat(wikitext, "") .. table.concat(categories, "\n")
    end
end

local grade1_pattern = ("[" .. data.grade1 .. "]")
local grade2_pattern = ("[" .. data.grade2 .. "]")
local grade3_pattern = ("[" .. data.grade3 .. "]")
local grade4_pattern = ("[" .. data.grade4 .. "]")
local grade5_pattern = ("[" .. data.grade5 .. "]")
local grade6_pattern = ("[" .. data.grade6 .. "]")
local secondary_pattern = ("[" .. data.secondary .. "]")
local jinmeiyo_kanji_pattern = ("[" .. data.jinmeiyo_kanji .. "]")
local hyogaiji_pattern = ("[^" .. data.joyo_kanji .. data.jinmeiyo_kanji .. "]")

function export.kanji_grade(kanji)
    if type(kanji) == "table" then kanji = kanji.args[1] end

    if find(kanji, hyogaiji_pattern) then
        return 9
    elseif find(kanji, jinmeiyo_kanji_pattern) then
        return 8
    elseif find(kanji, secondary_pattern) then
        return 7
    elseif find(kanji, grade6_pattern) then
        return 6
    elseif find(kanji, grade5_pattern) then
        return 5
    elseif find(kanji, grade4_pattern) then
        return 4
    elseif find(kanji, grade3_pattern) then
        return 3
    elseif find(kanji, grade2_pattern) then
        return 2
    elseif find(kanji, grade1_pattern) then
        return 1
    end

    return false
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="145">
<source>wikt/translit/jdt-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local tt_he_a2 = {["××•"] = "y", ["××™"] = "e", ["×Ö¸"] = "o", ["×Ö·"] = "a", ["×Ö´"] = "i"}

local tt_he_dg = {["×›Ö¼"] = "k", ["×šÖ¼"] = "k", ["×‘Ö¼"] = "b", ["×¤Ö¼"] = "p", ["×£Ö¼"] = "p", ["×’×³"] = "c", ["×–×³"] = "Ã§", ["×’'"] = "c", ["×–'"] = "Ã§"}

local tt_he = {["×"] = "É™", ["×‘"] = "v", ["×’"] = "g", ["×“"] = "d", ["×”"] = "h", ["×–"] = "z", ["×—"] = "Ä§", ["×™"] = "j", ["×›"] = "x", ["×š"] = "x", ["×œ"] = "l", ["×"] = "m", ["×"] = "m", ["× "] = "n", ["×Ÿ"] = "n", ["×¡"] = "s", ["×¢"] = "á¸©", ["×¤"] = "f", ["×£"] = "f", ["×¦"] = "c", ["×¥"] = "c", ["×§"] = "q", ["×¨"] = "r", ["×©"] = "ÅŸ", ["×ª"] = "t", ["×ª"] = "t", ["×ƒ"] = ":", ["×³"] = "'", ["×´"] = "\"", ["Ö¾"] = "-"}

local tt_cy_2 = {
    ["Ğ“Ğ¬"] = "H",
    ["Ğ“ÑŒ"] = "H",
    ["Ğ³Ğ¬"] = "h",
    ["Ğ³ÑŒ"] = "h",
    ["Ğ“Ó€"] = "á¸¨", -- palochka
    ["Ğ“Ó"] = "á¸¨", -- palochka (rare lowercase)
    ["Ğ“I"] = "á¸¨", -- Latn I
    ["Ğ“Ğ†"] = "á¸¨", -- Cyrl Ğ†
    ["Ğ“i"] = "á¸¨", -- Latn i
    ["Ğ“Ñ–"] = "á¸¨", -- Cyrl Ñ–
    ["Ğ³Ó€"] = "á¸©", -- palochka
    ["Ğ³Ó"] = "á¸©", -- palochka (rare lowercase)
    ["Ğ³I"] = "á¸©", -- Latn I
    ["Ğ³Ğ†"] = "á¸©", -- Cyrl Ğ†
    ["Ğ³i"] = "á¸©", -- Latn i
    ["Ğ³Ñ–"] = "á¸©", -- Cyrl Ñ–
    ["Ğ¥Ğ¬"] = "Ä¦",
    ["Ğ¥ÑŒ"] = "Ä¦",
    ["Ñ…Ğ¬"] = "Ä§",
    ["Ñ…ÑŒ"] = "Ä§",
    ["Ğ“Ğª"] = "Q",
    ["Ğ“ÑŠ"] = "Q",
    ["Ğ³Ğª"] = "q",
    ["Ğ³ÑŠ"] = "q",
    ["Ğ£Ğ¬"] = "Y",
    ["Ğ£ÑŒ"] = "Y",
    ["ÑƒĞ¬"] = "y",
    ["ÑƒÑŒ"] = "y"
}

local tt_cy = {["Ğ"] = "A", ["Ğ°"] = "a", ["Ğ‘"] = "B", ["Ğ±"] = "b", ["Ğ§"] = "C", ["Ñ‡"] = "c", ["Ğ–"] = "Ã‡", ["Ğ¶"] = "Ã§", ["Ğ”"] = "D", ["Ğ´"] = "d", ["Ğ•"] = "E", ["Ğµ"] = "e", ["Ğ­"] = "Æ", ["Ñ"] = "É™", ["Ğ¤"] = "F", ["Ñ„"] = "f", ["Ğ“"] = "G", ["Ğ³"] = "g", ["Ğ˜"] = "I", ["Ğ¸"] = "i", ["Ğ™"] = "J", ["Ğ¹"] = "j", ["Ğš"] = "K", ["Ğº"] = "k", ["Ğ›"] = "L", ["Ğ»"] = "l", ["Ğœ"] = "M", ["Ğ¼"] = "m", ["Ğ"] = "N", ["Ğ½"] = "n", ["Ğ"] = "O", ["Ğ¾"] = "o", ["ĞŸ"] = "P", ["Ğ¿"] = "p", ["Ğ "] = "R", ["Ñ€"] = "r", ["Ğ¡"] = "S", ["Ñ"] = "s", ["Ğ¨"] = "Å", ["Ñˆ"] = "ÅŸ", ["Ğ¢"] = "T", ["Ñ‚"] = "t", ["Ğ£"] = "U", ["Ñƒ"] = "u", ["Ğ’"] = "V", ["Ğ²"] = "v", ["Ğ¥"] = "X", ["Ñ…"] = "x", ["Ğ—"] = "Z", ["Ğ·"] = "z"}

local tt_ipa = {["A"] = "a", ["a"] = "a", ["B"] = "b", ["b"] = "b", ["C"] = "tÊƒ", ["c"] = "tÊƒ", ["Ã‡"] = "dÊ’", ["Ã§"] = "dÊ’", ["D"] = "d", ["d"] = "d", ["E"] = "É›", ["e"] = "É›", ["Æ"] = "Ã¦", ["É™"] = "Ã¦", ["F"] = "f", ["f"] = "f", ["G"] = "É¡", ["g"] = "É¡", ["H"] = "h", ["h"] = "h", ["á¸¨"] = "Ê•", ["á¸©"] = "Ê•", ["Ä¦"] = "Ä§", ["Ä§"] = "Ä§", ["I"] = "Éª", ["i"] = "Éª", ["J"] = "j", ["j"] = "j", ["K"] = "k", ["k"] = "k", ["L"] = "l", ["l"] = "l", ["M"] = "m", ["m"] = "m", ["N"] = "n", ["n"] = "n", ["O"] = "o", ["o"] = "o", ["P"] = "p", ["p"] = "p", ["Q"] = "É¢", ["q"] = "É¢", ["R"] = "É¾", ["r"] = "É¾", ["S"] = "s", ["s"] = "s", ["Å"] = "Êƒ", ["ÅŸ"] = "Êƒ", ["T"] = "t", ["t"] = "t", ["U"] = "u", ["u"] = "u", ["V"] = "v", ["v"] = "v", ["X"] = "Ï‡", ["x"] = "Ï‡", ["Y"] = "y", ["y"] = "y", ["Z"] = "z", ["z"] = "z"}

local tt_tocy = {["A"] = "Ğ", ["a"] = "Ğ°", ["B"] = "Ğ‘", ["b"] = "Ğ±", ["C"] = "Ğ§", ["c"] = "Ñ‡", ["Ã‡"] = "Ğ–", ["Ã§"] = "Ğ¶", ["D"] = "d", ["d"] = "Ğ´", ["E"] = "Ğ•", ["e"] = "Ğµ", ["Æ"] = "Ğ­", ["É™"] = "Ñ", ["F"] = "Ğ¤", ["f"] = "Ñ„", ["G"] = "Ğ“", ["g"] = "Ğ³", ["H"] = "Ğ“ÑŒ", ["h"] = "Ğ³ÑŒ", ["á¸¨"] = "Ğ“Ó€", ["á¸©"] = "Ğ³Ó€", ["Ä¦"] = "Ğ¥ÑŒ", ["Ä§"] = "Ñ…ÑŒ", ["I"] = "Ğ˜", ["i"] = "Ğ¸", ["J"] = "Ğ™", ["j"] = "Ğ¹", ["K"] = "Ğš", ["k"] = "Ğº", ["L"] = "Ğ›", ["l"] = "Ğ»", ["M"] = "Ğœ", ["m"] = "Ğ¼", ["N"] = "Ğ", ["n"] = "Ğ½", ["O"] = "Ğ", ["o"] = "Ğ¾", ["P"] = "ĞŸ", ["p"] = "Ğ¿", ["Q"] = "Ğ“ÑŠ", ["q"] = "Ğ³ÑŠ", ["R"] = "Ğ ", ["r"] = "Ñ€", ["S"] = "Ğ¡", ["s"] = "Ñ", ["Å"] = "Ğ¨", ["ÅŸ"] = "Ñˆ", ["T"] = "Ğ¢", ["t"] = "Ñ‚", ["U"] = "Ğ£", ["u"] = "Ñƒ", ["V"] = "Ğ’", ["v"] = "Ğ²", ["X"] = "Ğ¥", ["x"] = "Ñ…", ["Y"] = "Ğ£ÑŒ", ["y"] = "ÑƒÑŒ", ["Z"] = "Ğ—", ["z"] = "Ğ·"}

local tt_tohe = {["A"] = "×Ö·", ["a"] = "×Ö·", ["B"] = "×‘Ö¼", ["b"] = "×‘Ö¼", ["C"] = "×’×³", ["c"] = "×’×³", ["Ã‡"] = "×–×³", ["Ã§"] = "×–×³", ["D"] = "×“", ["d"] = "×“", ["E"] = "××™", ["e"] = "××™", ["Æ"] = "×", ["É™"] = "×", ["F"] = "×¤", ["f"] = "×¤", ["G"] = "×’", ["g"] = "×’", ["H"] = "×”", ["h"] = "×”", ["á¸¨"] = "×¢", ["á¸©"] = "×¢", ["Ä¦"] = "×—", ["Ä§"] = "×—", ["I"] = "×Ö´", ["i"] = "×Ö´", ["J"] = "×™", ["j"] = "×™", ["K"] = "×›Ö¼", ["k"] = "×›Ö¼", ["L"] = "×œ", ["l"] = "×œ", ["M"] = "×", ["m"] = "×", ["N"] = "× ", ["n"] = "× ", ["O"] = "×Ö¸", ["o"] = "×Ö¸", ["P"] = "×¤Ö¼", ["p"] = "×¤Ö¼", ["Q"] = "×§", ["q"] = "×§", ["R"] = "×¨", ["r"] = "×¨", ["S"] = "×¡", ["s"] = "×¡", ["Å"] = "×©", ["ÅŸ"] = "×©", ["T"] = "×ª", ["t"] = "×ª", ["U"] = "××•Ö¼", ["u"] = "××•Ö¼", ["V"] = "×‘", ["v"] = "×‘", ["X"] = "×›", ["x"] = "×›", ["Y"] = "××•", ["y"] = "××•", ["Z"] = "×–", ["z"] = "×–"}

-- Keep in mind RTL issues when viewing the following:
local he_to_final = {["×›"] = "×š", ["×"] = "×", ["× "] = "×Ÿ", ["×¤"] = "×£", ["×¦"] = "×¥"}

local function tr_he(text)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "××•Ö¼", "u")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".%f[^×].", tt_he_a2)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".%f[×³Ö¼'].", tt_he_dg)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".", tt_he)
    return text
end

local function tr_cy(text)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".%f[Ó€IĞ†ÓiÑ–Ğ¬ÑŒĞªÑŠ].", tt_cy_2)
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".", tt_cy)
    return text
end

function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    if not sc then sc = require("scripts").findBestScript(text, require("languages").getByCode(lang or "jdt")):getCode() end

    if sc == "Hebr" then
        text = tr_he(text)
    elseif sc == "Cyrl" then
        text = tr_cy(text)
    else
        text = nil
    end

    return text
end

function export.ipa(text, lang, sc)
    if type(text) == "table" then
        local args = text:getParent().args
        text = args[1] ~= "" and args[1] or mw.title.getCurrentTitle().subpageText
        lang = args["lang"] ~= "" and args["lang"] or "jdt"
        sc = args["sc"] ~= "" and args["sc"]
    end
    return (mw.ustring.gsub(export.tr(text, lang, sc) or text, ".", tt_ipa))
end

function export.la(text, lang, sc)
    if type(text) == "table" then
        local args = text:getParent().args
        text = args[1] ~= "" and args[1] or mw.title.getCurrentTitle().subpageText
        lang = args["lang"] ~= "" and args["lang"] or "jdt"
        sc = args["sc"] ~= "" and args["sc"]
    end
    return (export.tr(text, lang, sc) or text)
end

function export.cy(text, lang, sc)
    if type(text) == "table" then
        local args = text:getParent().args
        text = args[1] ~= "" and args[1] or mw.title.getCurrentTitle().subpageText
        lang = args["lang"] ~= "" and args["lang"] or "jdt"
        sc = args["sc"] ~= "" and args["sc"]
    end
    return (mw.ustring.gsub(export.tr(text, lang, sc) or text, ".", tt_tocy))
end

local function he_finals_replacer(letter, rest) return (he_to_finals[letter] .. rest) end

local function he_finals(text)
    -- Keep in mind RTL issues when viewing the following pattern:
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "([×›×× ×¤×¦])([^×-×ª]-%f[%sÖ¾-])", he_finals_replacer)
    return text
end

function export.he(text, lang, sc)
    if type(text) == "table" then
        local args = text:getParent().args
        text = args[1] ~= "" and args[1] or mw.title.getCurrentTitle().subpageText
        lang = args["lang"] ~= "" and args["lang"] or "jdt"
        sc = args["sc"] ~= "" and args["sc"]
    end
    return he_finals(mw.ustring.gsub(export.tr(text, lang, sc) or text, ".", tt_tohe))
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="146">
<source>wikt/translit/jv-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local conv = {
    -- finals (U+A980 - U+A983):

    ["ê¦€"] = "m",
    ["ê¦"] = "ng",
    ["ê¦‚"] = "r",
    ["ê¦ƒ"] = "h",

    -- independent vowels (U+A984 - U+A98E):

    ["ê¦„"] = "a",
    ["ê¦„ê¦´"] = "a",
    ["ê¦…"] = "i",
    ["ê¦†"] = "i",
    ["ê¦‡"] = "i",
    ["ê¦ˆ"] = "u",
    ["ê¦ˆê¦´"] = "u",
    ["ê¦‰"] = "re",
    ["ê¦‰ê¦´"] = "reu",
    ["ê¦Š"] = "le",
    ["ê¦‹"] = "leu",
    ["ê¦Œ"] = "e",
    ["ê¦"] = "ai",
    ["ê¦"] = "o",

    -- independent consonants (U+A98F - U+A9B2):

    ["ê¦"] = "k",
    ["ê¦ê¦³"] = "kh",
    ["ê¦"] = "q",
    ["ê¦‘"] = "kh",
    ["ê¦’"] = "g",
    ["ê¦’ê¦³"] = "gh",
    ["ê¦“"] = "gh",
    ["ê¦”"] = "ng",
    ["ê¦”ê¦³"] = "'",

    ["ê¦•"] = "c",
    ["ê¦–"] = "ch",
    ["ê¦—"] = "j",
    ["ê¦—ê¦³"] = "z",
    ["ê¦˜"] = "jny",
    ["ê¦™"] = "jh",
    ["ê¦š"] = "ny",

    ["ê¦›"] = "th",
    ["ê¦œ"] = "th",
    ["ê¦"] = "dh",
    ["ê¦"] = "dh",
    ["ê¦Ÿ"] = "nn",

    ["ê¦ "] = "t",
    ["ê¦¡"] = "th",
    ["ê¦¢"] = "d",
    ["ê¦¢ê¦³"] = "dz",
    ["ê¦£"] = "dh",
    ["ê¦¤"] = "n",

    ["ê¦¥"] = "p",
    ["ê¦¥ê¦³"] = "f",
    ["ê¦¦"] = "ph",
    ["ê¦§"] = "b",
    ["ê¦¨"] = "bh",
    ["ê¦©"] = "m",

    ["ê¦ª"] = "y",
    ["ê¦«"] = "r",
    ["ê¦¬"] = "r",
    ["ê¦­"] = "l",
    ["ê¦®"] = "w",
    ["ê¦®ê¦³"] = "v",
    ["ê¦¯"] = "sh",
    ["ê¦°"] = "ss",
    ["ê¦±"] = "s",
    ["ê¦±ê¦³"] = "sy",
    ["ê¦²"] = "h",
    ["ê¦²ê¦³"] = "h",

    -- cecak_telu/nukta (U+A9B3):

    ["ê¦³"] = "",

    -- dependent vowels (U+A9B4 - A9BD):

    ["ê¦´"] = "a", -- tarung
    ["ê¦µ"] = "o",
    ["ê¦¶"] = "i",
    ["ê¦·"] = "i",
    ["ê¦¸"] = "u",
    ["ê¦¹"] = "Å«",
    ["ê¦º"] = "Ã©",
    ["ê¦ºê¦´"] = "o",
    ["ê¦»"] = "ai",
    ["ê¦»ê¦´"] = "au",
    ["ê¦¼"] = "e",
    ["ê¦½"] = "re",
    ["ê¦½ê¦´"] = "reu",

    -- medials (U+A9BE - U+A9BF):
    ["ê¦¾"] = "y",
    ["ê¦¿"] = "r",

    -- pangkon/virama (U+A9C0):

    ["ê§€"] = "",

    -- punctuation (U+A9C1 - U+A9CF):

    ["ê§"] = "(starts title)",
    ["ê§‚"] = "(ends title)",
    ["ê§ƒ"] = "(letter to younger age or lower rank)",
    ["ê§„"] = "(letter to equal age or equal rank)",
    ["ê§…"] = "(letter to older age or higher rank)",
    ["ê§†"] = "(pada windu)",
    ["ê§‡"] = ":", -- number indicator
    ["ê§ˆ"] = ",",
    ["ê§‰"] = ".",
    ["ê§Š"] = "\"",
    ["ê§‹"] = "//",
    ["ê§Œ"] = "(",
    ["ê§"] = ")",
    ["ê§"] = "<sup>2</sup>",

    -- digits (U+A9D0 - U+A9D9):

    ["ê§"] = "0",
    ["ê§‘"] = "1",
    ["ê§’"] = "2",
    ["ê§“"] = "3",
    ["ê§”"] = "4",
    ["ê§•"] = "5",
    ["ê§–"] = "6",
    ["ê§—"] = "7",
    ["ê§˜"] = "8",
    ["ê§™"] = "9",

    -- ellipsis (U+A9DE - U+A9DF):

    ["ê§"] = "-",
    ["ê§Ÿ"] = "-"
}

function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    local CSVC = {initial = "([ê¦-ê¦²]ê¦³?)", medial = "([ê¦¾ê¦¿]?)", nucleus = "([ê¦´-ê¦½ê§€]?ê¦´?)", final = "([ê¦€-ê¦ƒ]?)"}
    local VC = {nucleus = "([ê¦„-ê¦]ê¦´?)", final = "([ê¦€-ê¦ƒ]*)"}

    local number_indicator = "ê§‡"
    local digits = "[ê§-ê§™]"

    local initial = true

    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, CSVC.initial .. CSVC.medial .. CSVC.nucleus .. CSVC.final, function(a, b, c, d)
        a = conv[a] or error("Initial not recognized: " .. a)
        b = b == "" and "" or conv[b] or error("Medial not recognized: " .. b)
        c = c == "" and "a" or conv[c] or error("Nucleus not recognized: " .. c)
        d = d == "" and "" or conv[d] or error("Final not recognized: " .. d)
        if initial and a == "h" then a = "" end
        initial = false
        return a .. b .. c .. d
    end)

    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, VC.nucleus .. VC.final, function(a, b)
        a = conv[a]
        b = (b == "" and "" or conv[b])
        initial = false
        return a .. b
    end)

    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, number_indicator .. "(" .. digits .. "+)" .. number_indicator, function(a)
        a = mw.ustring.gsub(a, ".", conv)
        initial = true
        return a
    end)

    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".", conv)

    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="147">
<source>wikt/translit/kaa-translit.lua</source>

local export = {}

local tt = {
    ["Ò¯"] = "Ã¼",

<document index="148">
<source>wikt/translit/kap-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local mapping1 = {["Ğ¿"] = "p", ["Ğ±"] = "b", ["Ñ‚"] = "t", ["Ğ´"] = "d", ["Ğº"] = "k", ["Ğ³"] = "g", ["Ñ†"] = "c", ["Ñ‡"] = "Ä", ["Ñ"] = "s", ["Ğ·"] = "z", ["Ñˆ"] = "Å¡", ["Ğ¶"] = "Å¾", ["Ñ…"] = "x", ["Ğ¼"] = "m", ["Ğ½"] = "n", ["Ñ€"] = "r", ["Ğ»"] = "l", ["Ğ²"] = "v", ["Ğ¹"] = "y", ["Ğ¸"] = "i", ["Ğµ"] = "e", ["Ñ"] = "e", ["Ğ°"] = "a", ["Ğ¾"] = "o", ["Ñƒ"] = "u", ["ÑŠ"] = "Ê¾", ["áµ¸"] = "Ìƒ"}

local mapping2 = {["Ğ¿Ó"] = "pâ€™", ["Ñ‚Ó"] = "tâ€™", ["ĞºÓ"] = "kâ€™", ["ĞºÑŠ"] = "qâ€™", ["Ñ†Ó"] = "câ€™", ["Ğ»Ó"] = "Æ›", ["ĞºÑŒ"] = "Æ›â€™", ["Ñ‡Ó"] = "câ€™ÌŒ", ["Ñ…ÑŠ"] = "q", ["Ğ»ÑŠ"] = "Î»", ["Ğ³ÑŠ"] = "Ä¡", ["Ñ…Ó"] = "á¸¥", ["Ğ³Ó"] = "aÌ¯", ["Ğ³ÑŒ"] = "h", ["Ğ°ÑŒ"] = "Ã¤", ["Ğ¾ÑŒ"] = "Ã¶", ["ÑƒÑŒ"] = "Ã¼", ["Ğ°áµ¸"] = "Ã£", ["Ğµáµ¸"] = "áº½", ["Ğ¸áµ¸"] = "Ä©", ["Ğ¾áµ¸"] = "Ãµ", ["Ñƒáµ¸"] = "Å©"}

local tetragraph = {["Ğ°ÑŒáµ¸"] = "Ã¤Ìƒ"}

function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    local str_gsub = string.gsub
    local UTF8_char = "[%z\1-\127\194-\244][\128-\191]*"

    -- Convert capital to lowercase palochka.
    text = str_gsub(text, mw.ustring.char(0x4C0), mw.ustring.char(0x4CF))

    for pat, repl in pairs(mapping2) do text = str_gsub(text, pat, repl) end

    for tetragraph, replacement in pairs(tetragraph) do text = str_gsub(text, tetragraph, replacement) end

    text = str_gsub(text, UTF8_char, mapping1)

    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="149">
<source>wikt/translit/kbd-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local tt = {["Ğ°"] = "Ä", ["Ğ±"] = "b", ["Ğ²"] = "v", ["Ğ³"] = "Î³", ["Ğ´"] = "d", ["Ğµ"] = "e", ["Ñ‘"] = "Ã«", ["Ğ¶"] = "Å¾", ["Ğ·"] = "z", ["Ğ¸"] = "i", ["Ğ¹"] = "j", ["Ğº"] = "k", ["Ğ»"] = "l", ["Ğ¼"] = "m", ["Ğ½"] = "n", ["Ğ¾"] = "o", ["Ğ¿"] = "p", ["Ñ€"] = "r", ["Ñ"] = "s", ["Ñ‚"] = "t", ["Ñƒ"] = "w", ["Ñ„"] = "f", ["Ñ…"] = "x", ["Ñ†"] = "c", ["Ñ‡"] = "Ä", ["Ñˆ"] = "Å¡", ["Ñ‰"] = "Å", ["ÑŠ"] = "â€", ["Ñ‹"] = "É™", ["ÑŒ"] = "â€™", ["Ñ"] = "Äƒ", ["Ñ"] = "ju", ["Ñ"] = "jÄ", ["Ó"] = "Ê¾", ["Ğ"] = "Ä€", ["Ğ‘"] = "B", ["Ğ’"] = "V", ["Ğ“"] = "Î“", ["Ğ”"] = "D", ["Ğ•"] = "E", ["Ğ"] = "Ã‹", ["Ğ–"] = "Å½", ["Ğ—"] = "Z", ["Ğ˜"] = "I", ["Ğ™"] = "J", ["Ğš"] = "K", ["Ğ›"] = "L", ["Ğœ"] = "M", ["Ğ"] = "N", ["Ğ"] = "O", ["ĞŸ"] = "P", ["Ğ "] = "R", ["Ğ¡"] = "S", ["Ğ¢"] = "T", ["Ğ£"] = "W", ["Ğ¤"] = "F", ["Ğ¥"] = "X", ["Ğ¦"] = "C", ["Ğ§"] = "ÄŒ", ["Ğ¨"] = "Å ", ["Ğ©"] = "Åœ", ["Ğª"] = "â€", ["Ğ«"] = "Æ", ["Ğ¬"] = "â€™", ["Ğ­"] = "Ä‚", ["Ğ®"] = "Ju", ["Ğ¯"] = "JÄ", ["Ó"] = "Ê¾"};

local trigraphs = {["ĞºÑ…ÑŠÑƒ"] = "qÂ°", ["ĞšÑ…ÑŠÑƒ"] = "QÂ°", ["Ğ³ÑŠÑƒ"] = "Ä¡Â°", ["ĞšÑ…ÑŠ"] = "Q", ["ĞºÑ…ÑŠ"] = "q", ["ĞºÑŠÑƒ"] = "qÌ‡Â°", ["ĞºÓÑƒ"] = "á¸³Â°", ["Ñ…ÑŠÑƒ"] = "Ï‡Â°"}

local digraphs = {["Ğ³Ñƒ"] = "gÂ°", ["Ğ³ÑŒ"] = "É¡â€™", ["Ğ³ÑŠ"] = "Ä¡", ["Ğ´Ğ¶"] = "Ç¯Ì", ["Ğ´Ğ·"] = "Ê’", ["Ğ¶ÑŠ"] = "áº‘", ["Ğ¶ÑŒ"] = "áº‘", ["ĞºÑƒ"] = "kÂ°", ["ĞºÑŠ"] = "qÌ‡", ["ĞºÓ"] = "ÄÌ£Ì", ["Ğ»ÑŠ"] = "Å‚", ["Ğ»Ó"] = "á¸·", ["Ğ¿Ó"] = "á¹—", ["ÑÓ"] = "á¹£Ì£", ["Ñ‚Ó"] = "á¹­", ["Ñ„Ó"] = "fÌ£", ["Ñ…Ñƒ"] = "xÂ°", ["Ñ…ÑŠ"] = "Ï‡", ["Ñ…ÑŒ"] = "á¸¥", ["Ñ†Ó"] = "cÌ£", ["Ñ‡Ñƒ"] = "ÄÌÂ°", ["Ñ‰Ó"] = "á¹£Ì‚", ["ÓÑƒ"] = "Ê¾Â°", ["Ğ“ÑŠÑƒ"] = "Ä Â°", ["ĞšÑŠÑƒ"] = "QÌ‡Â°", ["ĞšÓÑƒ"] = "á¸²Â°", ["Ğ¥ÑŠÑƒ"] = "Î§Â°", ["Ğ“Ñƒ"] = "GÂ°", ["Ğ“ÑŒ"] = "É¡â€™", ["Ğ“ÑŠ"] = "Ä ", ["Ğ”Ğ¶"] = "Ç®Ì", ["Ğ”Ğ·"] = "Æ·", ["Ğ–ÑŠ"] = "áº", ["Ğ–ÑŒ"] = "áºÌ‚", ["ĞšÑƒ"] = "KÂ°", ["ĞšÑŠ"] = "QÌ‡", ["ĞšÓ"] = "ÄŒÌ£Ì", ["Ğ›ÑŠ"] = "Å", ["Ğ›Ó"] = "á¸¶", ["ĞŸÓ"] = "á¹–", ["Ğ¡Ó"] = "á¹¢Ì£", ["Ğ¢Ó"] = "á¹¬", ["Ğ¤Ó"] = "FÌ£", ["Ğ¥Ñƒ"] = "XÂ°", ["Ğ¥ÑŠ"] = "Î§", ["Ğ¥ÑŒ"] = "á¸¤", ["Ğ¦Ó"] = "CÌ£", ["Ğ§Ñƒ"] = "ÄŒÌÂ°", ["Ğ©Ó"] = "á¹¢Ì‚"}

function export.tr(text)
    local str_gsub = string.gsub
    local UTF8char = "[%z\1-\127\194-\244][\128-\191]*"

    -- Convert uppercase palochka to lowercase. Lowercase is found in tables
    -- above.
    text = str_gsub(text, mw.ustring.char(0x4C0), mw.ustring.char(0x4CF))

    for trigraph, replacement in pairs(trigraphs) do text = str_gsub(text, trigraph, replacement) end

    for digraph, replacement in pairs(digraphs) do text = str_gsub(text, digraph, replacement) end

    text = str_gsub(text, UTF8char, tt)

    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

local export = {}

local tt = {
    ["Ğ°"] = "a",
    ["Ó“"] = "Ã¤",
    ["Ó‘"] = "Äƒ",
    ["Ğ±"] = "b",
    ["Ğ²"] = "w",
    ["Ğ³"] = "g",
    ["Ğ´"] = "d",
    ["Ğµ"] = "e",
    ["Ñ‘"] = "Ã«",
    ["Ó™"] = "É™",
    ["Ó›"] = "É™Ì‚",

<document index="151">
<source>wikt/translit/kdr-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}
local tab = {
    ["Ğ"] = "A",
    ["Ğ‘"] = "B",
    ["Ğ’"] = "V",
    ["Ğ“"] = "G",
    ["Ğ”"] = "D",
    ["Ğ•"] = "E",
    ["Ğ"] = "Yo",
    ["Ğ–"] = "J",
    ["Ğ—"] = "Z",
    ["Ğ˜"] = "I",
    ["Ğ™"] = "Y",

    ["Ğš"] = "K",
    ["Ğ›"] = "L",
    ["Ğœ"] = "M",
    ["Ğ"] = "N",
    ["Ğ"] = "O",
    ["Ó¦"] = "Ã–",
    ["ĞŸ"] = "P",
    ["Ğ "] = "R",
    ["Ğ¡"] = "S",
    ["Ğ¢"] = "T",
    ["Ğ£"] = "U",
    ["Ó°"] = "Ãœ",
    ["Ğ¤"] = "F",
    ["Ğ¥"] = "Kh",
    ["Òº"] = "H",
    ["Ğ¦"] = "Ts",
    ["Ğ§"] = "Ã‡",
    ["Ğ¨"] = "Å ",
    ["Ğ©"] = "ÅÃ§",
    ["Ğª"] = "Êº",
    ["Ğ«"] = "Ä°",
    ["Ğ¬"] = "Ê¹",
    ["Ğ­"] = "E",
    ["Ğ®"] = "Yu",
    ["Ğ¯"] = "Ya",
    ["Ğ°"] = "a",
    ["Ğ±"] = "b",
    ["Ğ²"] = "v",
    ["Ğ³"] = "g",
    ["Ğ´"] = "d",
    ["Ğµ"] = "e",
    ["Ñ‘"] = "yo",
    ["Ğ¶"] = "j",
    ["Ğ·"] = "z",
    ["Ğ¸"] = "i",
    ["Ğ¹"] = "y",
    ["Ğº"] = "k",
    ["Ğ»"] = "l",
    ["Ğ¼"] = "m",
    ["Ğ½"] = "n",
    ["Ğ¾"] = "o",
    ["Ó§"] = "Ã¶",
    ["Ğ¿"] = "p",
    ["Ñ€"] = "r",
    ["Ñ"] = "s",
    ["Ñ‚"] = "t",
    ["Ñƒ"] = "u",
    ["Ó±"] = "Ã¼",
    ["Ñ„"] = "f",
    ["Ñ…"] = "kh",
    ["Ñ†"] = "ts",
    ["Ñ‡"] = "Ã§",
    ["Ñˆ"] = "ÅŸ",
    ["Ñ‰"] = "ÅŸÃ§",
    ["ÑŠ"] = "Êº",
    ["Ñ‹"] = "Ä±",
    ["ÑŒ"] = "Ê¹",
    ["Ñ"] = "e",
    ["Ñ"] = "yu",
    ["Ñ"] = "ya"
}
local mapping = {["Ğ´Ğ¶"] = "c", ["Ğ”Ğ¶"] = "C", ["Ò£"] = "Ã±", ["Ò¢"] = "Ã‘", ["ĞºÑŠ"] = "q", ["ĞšÑŠ"] = "Q", ["Ğ½ÑŠ"] = "Ã±", ["ĞÑŠ"] = "Ã‘"}
function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    -- Ğ needs converting if is decomposed
    text = text:gsub("Ñ‘", "Ñ‘"):gsub("Ğ", "Ğ")

    -- Ğµ after a vowel or at the beginning of a text becomes ye
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "([ĞĞÓ¨Ğ£Ò®Ğ«Ğ•Ğ¯ĞĞ®Ğ˜Ğ•ĞªĞ¬Ğ°Ğ¾Ó©ÑƒÒ¯Ñ‹ÑÑÑ‘ÑĞ¸ĞµÑŠÑŒ%A][\204\129\204\128]?)Ğµ", "%1yÃ¶")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "^Ğ•", "YÃ¶")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "^Ğµ", "yÃ¶")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "([^Ğ€-Ó¿])Ğ•", "%1yÃ¶")
    text = mw.ustring.gsub(text, "([^Ğ€-Ó¿])Ğµ", "%1yÃ¶")

    return (mw.ustring.gsub(text, ".", tab))
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="152">
<source>wikt/translit/kham-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}
local gsub = mw.ustring.gsub
local match = mw.ustring.match

local conv = {
    -- consonants
    ["à¤•"] = "k",
    ["à¤–"] = "kh",
    ["à¤—"] = "g",
    ["à¤˜"] = "gh",
    ["à¤™"] = "á¹…",
    ["à¤š"] = "c",
    ["à¤›"] = "ch",
    ["à¤œ"] = "j",
    ["à¤"] = "jh",
    ["à¤"] = "Ã±",
    ["à¤Ÿ"] = "á¹­",
    ["à¤ "] = "á¹­h",
    ["à¤¡"] = "á¸",
    ["à¤¢"] = "á¸h",
    ["à¤£"] = "á¹‡",
    ["à¤¤"] = "t",
    ["à¤¥"] = "th",
    ["à¤¦"] = "d",
    ["à¤§"] = "dh",
    ["à¤¨"] = "n",
    ["à¤ª"] = "p",
    ["à¤«"] = "ph",
    ["à¤¬"] = "b",
    ["à¤­"] = "bh",
    ["à¤®"] = "m",
    ["à¤¯"] = "y",
    ["à¤°"] = "r",
    ["à¤²"] = "l",
    ["à¤µ"] = "w",
    ["à¤³"] = "á¸·",
    ["à¤¶"] = "Å›",
    ["à¤·"] = "á¹£",
    ["à¤¸"] = "s",
    ["à¤¹"] = "h",
    ["à¤œà¤¼"] = "z",
    ["à¤à¤¼"] = "zh",
    ["à¤µà¤¼"] = "áº",
    --
    ["à¤•à¤¼"] = "q",
    ["à¤–à¤¼"] = "x",
    ["à¤—à¤¼"] = "Ä¡",
    ["à¤´"] = "á¸»",
    ["à¤¡à¤¼"] = "á¹›",
    ["à¤¢à¤¼"] = "á¹›h",
    ["à¤«à¤¼"] = "f",
    ["à¤¥à¤¼"] = "Î¸",
    ["à¤¦à¤¼"] = "Ã°",
    ["à¤©"] = "á¹‰",
    ["à¤±"] = "á¹Ÿ",
    ["à¤¸à¤¼"] = "z",
    ["à¤šà¤¼"] = "c",
    ["à¤›à¤¼"] = "ch",
    ["à¥¹"] = "Å¾",
    ["à¤¶à¤¼"] = "Å¾",
    -- vowel diacritics
    ["à¤¿"] = "i",
    ["à¥"] = "u",
    ["à¥‡"] = "e",
    ["à¥‹"] = "o",
    ["à¤¾"] = "Ä",
    ["à¥€"] = "Ä«",
    ["à¥‚"] = "Å«",
    ["à¥ƒ"] = "rÌ¥",
    ["à¥„"] = "rÌ¥Ì„",
    ["à¥¢"] = "lÌ¥",
    ["à¥£"] = "lÌ¥Ì„",
    ["à¥ˆ"] = "ai",
    ["à¥Œ"] = "au",
    ["à¥‰"] = "Å",
    ["à¥…"] = "Ä•",
    ["à¥†"] = "e",
    ["à¥Š"] = "o",
    -- vowel signs
    ["à¤…"] = "a",
    ["à¤‡"] = "i",
    ["à¤‡à¤¼"] = "Ã¼",
    ["à¤‰"] = "u",
    ["à¤‰à¤¼"] = "Ã¯",
    ["à¤"] = "e",
    ["à¤à¤¼"] = "Ã¸",
    ["à¤“"] = "o",
    ["à¤†"] = "Ä",
    ["à¤ˆ"] = "Ä«",
    ["à¤Š"] = "Å«",
    ["à¤‹"] = "rÌ¥",
    ["à¥ "] = "rÌ¥Ì„",
    ["à¤Œ"] = "lÌ¥",
    ["à¥¡"] = "lÌ¥Ì„",
    ["à¤"] = "ai",
    ["à¤”"] = "au",
    ["à¤‘"] = "Å",
    ["à¥²"] = "Ä•",
    ["à¤"] = "Ä•",
    ["à¤"] = "e",
    ["à¤’"] = "o",
    -- chandrabindu
    ["à¤"] = "Ìƒ",
    -- anusvara
    ["à¤‚"] = "Ìƒ",
    -- visarga
    ["à¤ƒ"] = "á¸¥",
    -- virama
    ["à¥"] = "",
    -- glottal stop
    ["à¥½"] = "â€™",
    -- high spacing dot
    ["à¥±"] = "'",
    -- avagraha
    ["à¤½"] = "'",
    --- dot
    ["."] = "'",
    --
    ["Â°"] = "'",
    -- numerals
    ["à¥¦"] = "0",
    ["à¥§"] = "1",
    ["à¥¨"] = "2",
    ["à¥©"] = "3",
    ["à¥ª"] = "4",
    ["à¥«"] = "5",
    ["à¥¬"] = "6",
    ["à¥­"] = "7",
    ["à¥®"] = "8",
    ["à¥¯"] = "9",
    -- punctuation
    ["à¥¤"] = ".", -- danda
    ["à¥¥"] = ".", -- double danda
    ["+"] = "", -- compound separator
    -- abbreviation sign
    ["à¥°"] = "."
}

local all_cons, special_cons = "à¤•à¤–à¤—à¤˜à¤™à¤šà¤›à¤œà¤à¤à¤Ÿà¤ à¤¡à¤¢à¤£à¤¤à¤¥à¤¦à¤§à¤¨à¤ªà¤«à¤¬à¤­à¤®à¤¯à¤°à¤²à¤µà¤¸à¤¶à¤·à¤¹", "à¤•à¤–à¤—à¤˜à¤šà¤›à¤œà¤à¤Ÿà¤ à¤¡à¤¢à¤£à¤¤à¤¥à¤¦à¤§à¤¨à¤ªà¤«à¤¬à¤­à¤®à¤¯à¤°à¤²à¤µà¤¶à¤·à¤¸à¤¹"
local vowel, vowel_sign = "aà¤¿à¥à¥ƒà¥‡à¥‹à¤¾à¥€à¥‚à¥ˆà¥Œà¥‰à¥…à¥†à¥Šà¥„à¥¢à¥£à¥†à¥Š", "à¤…à¤‡à¤‰à¤à¤“à¤†à¤ˆà¤Šà¤‹à¥ à¥¡à¤Œà¤à¤”à¤à¤’à¤à¤¼à¤‡à¤¼à¤‘à¤"

local function rev_string(text)
    local result, length = {}, mw.ustring.len(text)
    for i = length, 1, -1 do table.insert(result, mw.ustring.sub(text, i, i)) end
    return table.concat(result)
end
function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    text = gsub(text, "([" .. all_cons .. "]à¤¼?)([" .. vowel .. "à¥]?)", function(c, d) return c .. (d == "" and "a" or d) end)
    for word in mw.ustring.gmatch(text, "[à¤€-à¥¿a]+") do
        local orig_word = word
        word = rev_string(word)
        word = gsub(word, "^a(à¤¼?)([" .. all_cons .. "])(.)(.?)", function(opt, first, second, third) return (((match(first, "[" .. special_cons .. "]") and match(second, "à¤‚") or match(first, "[" .. special_cons .. "]") and match(second, "à¥") and not perm_cl[first .. second .. third]) or match(first .. second, "à¤¯[aà¤¿à¥à¥ƒà¥‡à¥‹à¤¾à¥€à¥‚à¥ˆà¥Œà¥‰à¥…à¥†à¥Šà¤†à¤ˆà¤‰à¤Šà¤‡à¤à¤à¤“à¤”]") or match(first .. second, "à¤¹[à¤…aà¤¿à¥à¥ƒà¥‡à¥‹à¤¾à¥€à¥‚à¥ˆà¥Œà¥‰à¥…à¥†à¥Šà¤†à¤ˆà¤‰à¤Šà¤‡à¤à¤à¤“à¤”]")) and "a" or "") .. opt .. first .. second .. third end)

        local escaped_orig_word = gsub(orig_word, "%+", "")
        text = gsub(text, orig_word, rev_string(word))
        text = gsub(text, "à¤œà¥à¤", "gy")
        text = gsub(text, "à¥±([" .. all_cons .. "])(à¤¼?)(à¥?)([à¤µà¤¯à¤°à¤²]?)(à¤¼?)([" .. vowel .. "]?)([à¤à¤à¤‚]?)(à¤ƒ?)", "%1%2%3%4%5%6%7%8'")
    end
    text = gsub(text, ".à¤¼?", conv)
    text = gsub(text, "a([iu])Ìƒ", "aÍ %1")
    text = gsub(text, "rhÌ¥", "hrÌ¥")
    text = gsub(text, "[<>]", "")
    return mw.ustring.toNFC(text)
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="153">
<source>wikt/translit/khv-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local mapping1 = {["Ğ¿"] = "p", ["Ğ±"] = "b", ["Ñ‚"] = "t", ["Ğ´"] = "d", ["Ğº"] = "k", ["Ğ³"] = "g", ["Ñ†"] = "c", ["Ñ‡"] = "Ä", ["Ñ"] = "s", ["Ğ·"] = "z", ["Ñˆ"] = "Å¡", ["Ğ¶"] = "Å¾", ["Ñ…"] = "x", ["Ğ¼"] = "m", ["Ğ½"] = "n", ["Ñ€"] = "r", ["Ğ»"] = "l", ["Ğ²"] = "v", ["Ğ¹"] = "y", ["Ğ°"] = "a", ["Ğµ"] = "e", ["Ñ"] = "e", ["Ğ¸"] = "i", ["Ğ¾"] = "o", ["Ñƒ"] = "u", ["Ñ‹"] = "É¨", ["Ä"] = "Ä", ["ĞµÌ„"] = "Ä“", ["Ó£"] = "Ä«", ["Ğ¾Ì„"] = "Å", ["Ó¯"] = "Å«", ["Ñ‹Ì„"] = "É¨Ì„", ["ÑŠ"] = "Ê¾"}

local mapping2 = {["Ğ¿Ó"] = "pâ€™", ["Ñ‚Ó"] = "tâ€™", ["ĞºÓ"] = "kâ€™", ["ĞºÑŠ"] = "qâ€™", ["Ñ†Ó"] = "câ€™", ["Ğ»Ó"] = "Æ›", ["ĞºÑŒ"] = "Æ›â€™", ["Ñ‡Ó"] = "Äâ€™", ["Ñ…ÑŠ"] = "q", ["Ğ»ÑŠ"] = "Î»", ["Ğ³ÑŠ"] = "Ä¡", ["Ñ…Ó"] = "á¸¥", ["Ğ³Ó"] = "aÌ¯", ["Ğ³ÑŒ"] = "h", ["Ğ°áµ¸"] = "Ã£", ["Ğµáµ¸"] = "áº½", ["Ñáµ¸"] = "áº½", ["Ğ¸áµ¸"] = "Ä©", ["Ğ¾áµ¸"] = "Ãµ", ["Ñƒáµ¸"] = "Å©", ["Ğ°Ó"] = "aÊ¿", ["ĞµÓ"] = "eÊ¿", ["Ğ¸Ó"] = "iÊ¿", ["Ğ¾Ó"] = "oÊ¿", ["ÑƒÓ"] = "uÊ¿"}

function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    local str_gsub = string.gsub
    local UTF8_char = "[%z\1-\127\194-\244][\128-\191]*"

    text = str_gsub(text, mw.ustring.char(0x4C0), mw.ustring.char(0x4CF))

    for pat, repl in pairs(mapping2) do text = str_gsub(text, pat, repl) end
    text = str_gsub(text, UTF8_char, mapping1)

    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="156">
<source>wikt/translit/kjj-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}

local tt = {["Ğ±"] = "b", ["Ğ¿"] = "p", ["Ğ²"] = "w", ["Ñ„"] = "f", ["Ğ´"] = "d", ["Ñ‚"] = "t", ["Ñ†"] = "c", ["Ğ·"] = "z", ["Ñ"] = "s", ["Ñ‡"] = "Ä", ["Ğ¶"] = "Å¾", ["Ñˆ"] = "Å¡", ["Ğ³"] = "g", ["Ğº"] = "k", ["Ñ…"] = "Ï‡", ["ÑŠ"] = "Ê”", ["Ğ¼"] = "m", ["Ğ½"] = "n", ["Ñ€"] = "r", ["Ğ»"] = "l", ["Ğ¹"] = "j", ["Ğ¸"] = "i", ["Ğµ"] = "e", ["Ñ"] = "e", ["Ğ°"] = "a", ["Ğ¾"] = "o", ["Ñƒ"] = "u", ["Ñ‹"] = "É¨", ["Ğ‘"] = "B", ["ĞŸ"] = "P", ["Ğ’"] = "W", ["Ğ¤"] = "F", ["Ğ”"] = "D", ["Ğ¢"] = "T", ["Ğ¦"] = "C", ["Ğ—"] = "Z", ["Ğ¡"] = "S", ["Ğ§"] = "ÄŒ", ["Ğ–"] = "Å½", ["Ğ¨"] = "Å ", ["Ğ“"] = "G", ["Ğš"] = "K", ["Ğ¥"] = "Î§", ["Ğª"] = "Ê”", ["Ğœ"] = "M", ["Ğ"] = "N", ["Ğ "] = "R", ["Ğ›"] = "L", ["Ğ™"] = "J", ["Ğ˜"] = "I", ["Ğ•"] = "E", ["Ğ­"] = "E", ["Ğ"] = "A", ["Ğ"] = "O", ["Ğ£"] = "U", ["Ğ«"] = "Æ—"};

local tetraTrigraphs = {["ĞºÑŠĞºÑŠ"] = "qË", ["ĞºÑ…ÑŒ"] = "kx", ["ĞšÑŠĞºÑŠ"] = "QË", ["ĞšÑ…ÑŒ"] = "Kx"}

local digraphs = {["Ğ¿Ğ¿"] = "pË", ["Ğ¿Ó"] = "á¹—", ["Ğ²Ğ²"] = "wË", ["Ñ‚Ñ‚"] = "tË", ["Ñ‚Ó"] = "á¹­", ["Ñ†Ñ†"] = "cË", ["Ñ†Ó"] = "cÌ£", ["Ğ´Ğ¶"] = "Ç¯", ["Ñ‡Ñ‡"] = "ÄË", ["Ñ‡Ó"] = "ÄÌ£", ["ĞºĞº"] = "kË", ["ĞºÓ"] = "á¸³", ["Ğ³Ğ³"] = "É£", ["Ñ…ÑŒ"] = "x", ["ĞºÑŠ"] = "qË", ["Ñ…ÑŠ"] = "q", ["ĞºÑŒ"] = "qÌ‡", ["Ğ³ÑŠ"] = "Ê", ["Ğ³Ó"] = "Ê•", ["Ñ…Ó"] = "Ä§", ["Ğ³ÑŒ"] = "h", ["ÑƒÑŒ"] = "Ã¼", ["Ğ¾ÑŒ"] = "Ã¶", ["Ğ°ÑŒ"] = "Ã¤", ["ĞŸĞ¿"] = "PË", ["ĞŸÓ"] = "á¹–", ["Ğ’Ğ²"] = "WË", ["Ğ¢Ñ‚"] = "TË", ["Ğ¢Ó"] = "á¹¬", ["Ğ¦Ñ†"] = "CË", ["Ğ¦Ó"] = "CÌ£", ["Ğ”Ğ¶"] = "Ç®", ["Ğ§Ñ‡"] = "ÄŒË", ["Ğ§Ó"] = "ÄŒÌ£", ["ĞšĞº"] = "KË", ["ĞšÓ"] = "á¸²", ["Ğ“Ğ³"] = "Æ”", ["Ğ¥ÑŒ"] = "X", ["ĞšÑŠ"] = "QË", ["Ğ¥ÑŠ"] = "Q", ["ĞšÑŒ"] = "QÌ‡", ["Ğ“ÑŠ"] = "Ê", ["Ğ“Ó"] = "Ê•", ["Ğ¥Ó"] = "Ä¦", ["Ğ“ÑŒ"] = "H", ["Ğ£ÑŒ"] = "Ãœ", ["ĞÑŒ"] = "Ã–", ["ĞÑŒ"] = "Ã„"}

function export.tr(text, lang, sc)
    local str_gsub = string.gsub
    local UTF8char = "[%z\1-\127\194-\244][\128-\191]*"

    -- Convert uppercase palochka to lowercase. Lowercase is found in tables
    -- above.
    text = str_gsub(text, mw.ustring.char(0x4C0), mw.ustring.char(0x4CF))

    for grapheme, replacement in pairs(tetraTrigraphs) do text = str_gsub(text, grapheme, replacement) end

    for digraph, replacement in pairs(digraphs) do text = str_gsub(text, digraph, replacement) end

    text = str_gsub(text, UTF8char, tt)

    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>

<document index="157">
<source>wikt/translit/kjp-translit.lua</source>
<document_content>
local export = {}
local u = mw.ustring.char
local gsub = mw.ustring.gsub
local match = mw.ustring.match

local initial_table = {["á€€"] = "k", ["á€"] = "kh", ["á€‚"] = "g", ["á€ƒ"] = "gh", ["á€„"] = "ng", ["á€…"] = "ts", ["á€†"] = "tsh", ["á€‡"] = "z", ["á€…á€»"] = "zh", ["á€Š"] = "ny", ["á€‹"] = "tta", ["á€Œ"] = "tth", ["á€"] = "dda", ["á€"] = "ddha", ["á®"] = "nna", ["á€"] = "t", ["á€‘"] = "th", ["á€’"] = "d", ["á€“"] = "dha", ["á€”"] = "n", ["á€•"] = "p", ["á€–"] = "ph", ["á€—"] = "f", ["á€˜"] = "bha", ["á€™"] = "m", ["á€š"] = "y", ["á€›"] = "r", ["á€œ"] = "l", ["á€"] = "w", ["á€"] = "x", ["á€Ÿ"] = "s", ["á€ "] = "h", ["á€¡"] = "ll", ["áœ"] = "â€™", ["á¯"] = "ywa", ["á°"] = "ghwa"}

local symbols = {["á€"] = "0", ["á"] = "1", ["á‚"] = "2", ["áƒ"] = "3", ["á„"] = "4", ["á…"] = "5", ["á†"] = "6", ["á‡"] = "7", ["áˆ"] = "8", ["á‰"] = "9", ["áŠ"] = "&#124;", ["á‹"] = "&#124;&#124;"}

function export.tr(text, lang, sc, debug_mode)
    local m_pron = require("my-pron").get_romanisation
    text = gsub(text, ".", symbols)
    for word in mw.ustring.gmatch(text, "[á€€-á‚Ÿê© -ê©»]+") do
        success, translit = pcall(m_pron, word, nil, {2, ["type"] = "orthographic", ["name"] = "MLCTS"}, 2, "translit_module")
        if success then
            text = gsub(text, word, translit, 1)
        else
            return nil
        end
    end
    if mw.ustring.match(text, "[á€€-á‚Ÿê© -ê©»]") and not debug_mode then return nil end
    return text
end

return export

</document_content>
</document>
